Description: Wall sherd of South Ionian pottery cup, probably a cup with everted rim; interior glazed black; exterior: black band above reserved band; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer suggests that the cup might belong to Type 9. The lack of diagonstic features makes it impossible to confirm shape of the cup. Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus, the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra, and at the site of Megara Hyblaea on Sicily. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape and they coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18).
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 713, no. 707)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 54, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.264) (Phase 3)
